If someone wants to engage in conversation with me I keep them on the ambient setting and adjust the pass through to a level that that I'm comfortable with.I've set my phone to stream to my headphones in LDAC which is Sony's codec for streaming in high quality. The setting is only available on my old Samsung S10 plus if I activate developer mode and then go into a developer menu that allows you to switch LDAC on. There are plenty of videos on YouTube that show you how to do it, but it's definitely worth doing. Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 29 December 2023Verified Purchase
I had one of these when I was around 6 years old and it helped my spelling immeasurably. Years later I would be diagnosed as having Dyslexia (as an adult) and the assessor believed that my time with the Speak & Spell was what made it so hard for my learning challenge to be discovered. Essentially, I had gotten used to seeing the words as an image, which is why I can spell well, despite having some issues reading from certain fonts and page colours. I brought this for my 6 year old granddaughters who adore it and have barely put it down since they got one for Christmas. To see the joy on their faces as they play with the Speak & Spell (even with the authentic American accent and spelling quirks), takes me right back to a happier time in my early youth. It makes their enjoyment of it feel so validating and is a testament to the effectiveness of the product and its design. Kids everywhere have way more advanced screens and sound on the most common of devices, but there is something to be said for the benefit of nostalgia, intertwined with shared child hood experiences that have 40 years between them. Couldn‚Äôt recommend enough.

The interface is user-friendly, and my child enjoys using it to practice spelling words.The game's simplicity makes it easy for kids to understand and engage with, which is a big plus. After a while, my child started to feel like they were repeating the same words, which can become monotonous and less challenging.I believe the Speak & Spell could be greatly enhanced if there was a way to input custom words or expand the word database through updates. This would allow parents and teachers to tailor the learning experience to match the child's level and progress.In conclusion, I still think the Speak & Spell is a great idea and a valuable tool for learning spelling. However, to make the most of it, it would be beneficial to supplement it with books or other resources that offer a broader selection of words. Report
AmazonCustomer4.0 out of 5 stars
Whether it works depends on the cause of your hair loss
Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 21 November 2021Verified Purchase
I'm a woman in my late 30s who's been losing hair due to a combination of stress, PCOS, and malabsorption for over a decade. It wasn't until the last year or so that I realised my hairline was severely receding. My temples were completely bare and my front hair line had been pushed back significantly, making my already large forehead look even bigger. I'm not a particularly vain person, but I was distressed. I was used to having bald patches on the back of my head that were covered by my waist length hair, but losing hair around my face was new.I looked into the various hair loss treatments, deciding the medication from the doctor had far too many side effects, and the shampoo didn't have nearly enough evidence that it actually worked, and so settled on the over the counter foam. If it didn't work then I'd only wasted 40 quid, and if it did, I could easily justify the price going forwards. It's no more than a coffee a week, if that. Incredibly, the "for women" version is twice the price for half the product, despite having identical ingredients now that they offer the same percentage of minoxidil. They suggest that men use the product twice a day, and women once, so I bought the "for men" for a much better deal and applied it once a day.When they say you'll lose hair when you start treatment, they mean it. But it is hair that you would have lost anyway, as part of the natural hair growth cycle, you're just losing it sooner. All of the hairs that I lost were very thin and weak compared to the rest still in my head. I didn't lose any thick hairs, or chunks, or start balding where I'd applied the product (on my temples and across the front of my hair line, where my hair loss was showing, even though there were many claims that this specific placement wouldn't work). I didn't have any topical reaction to the foam at all, except maybe some slight itching, but that could have been my imagination or even just the summer heat. I just lost the weak hairs that were going to fall out anyway, all at once, over the course of a couple of days. And then nothing.Within about a week of use, I could feel fluff on the previously completely smooth areas I'd been applying the product. Once nightly, although I definitely missed a few days here and there over the longer term. The foam itself dissolves quite quickly on the hand and I was finding it difficult to get it onto my head before it turned to liquid, which then ran down my face, so I started spraying it directly onto my head at one temple and spreading it across the top of my forehead to the other temple before rubbing it all in. Very sloppy, highly unattractive, but it worked for me. I made sure to massage the foam/liquid in to my problem areas until it had been absorbed, just like a moisturiser. Any that dripped down my face just got wiped up as I was washing my hands afterwards. It wasn't a big deal or difficult in any way. I managed to get my hair pretty damp when I was first figuring it out, but it dried down quickly and didn't leave any residue or need washing again or anything. I pretty much halved the amount they suggested using so that it stopped running down my face and didn't see any negative impact.Maybe a month after starting, I was losing one or two hairs every few days. Nothing at all compared to the brush full I'd have to pull off after brushing, or the massive amounts that would actually block the drain when I washed it. I switched to a Tangle Teezer as they're supposed to be more gentle, and carried on my haphazard application every day (or so) until last month, which was the 3 month mark. At this point I hadn't even finished the first of 3 bottles. That happened at 4 months, a few days ago.My hair has always grown fast, but I now have 3-ish inches of brand new growth around both temples and along my front hair line. I look like I'm growing in a rather pathetic fringe. There are still areas on my temples that haven't taken to the treatment and the hair is definitely not as dense as the rest of my head, but given the placement and the fact that I'm fair anyway, I feel like this is normal. I'm now applying the foam once every 3 or 4 days just to maintain what's there and have been doing this for a month so far without any hair loss as a result, although I'd not like to try and go without and have to start again. I've read a lot of people say that their growth started falling out within a week of stopping and complete loss occurred within a couple of months. Just the stuff they grew because of the foam, not their whole heads, this will not make you bald if you're not bald to start with. I've also noticed thickening on my head in areas where I haven't applied the foam, like at the back of my head where I do have thinning and patches but it can't be seen unless my hair is tied up tightly, and along my parting. I assume this is because the drug has entered my blood stream, but I haven't noticed growth anywhere else on my body increasing at all.I wouldn't say I'm a changed woman or that my hair loss has been completely reversed, but there is a very obvious and significant difference in pictures from July and November that I can only attribute to using this product. I had no expectations going in, but knew that if it did work, I'd need to keep using it. I don't see it as any different to taking a prescription medication, except instead of stopping a heart attack or diabetic attack, this stops hair loss. I still have 2 bottles left, and at the rate I go through it, they should last me until this time next year.I'd definitely give it a try if you're curious. A taxi home after a night out will cost you more, and you might end up surprised by the results. And if it doesn't work, there are options from your GP or even transplants if it comes to that. It's not going to work for everyone, but that's normal as we aren't all losing hair for the same reason.

user_reviews:
Mr Richard D Lock5.0 out of 5 stars
1 Month setup and usage review.
Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 8 January 2021Verified Purchase
Purchase was made late November. Item was received quickly through Prime membership.Item is presented in a nice box, that is strong and durable, not you usual flimsy type. Inside you get the actual Cronus Zen, 3 usb cables.(1) short cable for flashing firmware and then connection to device your going to be using it on. Connects to back of Zen(2) Programming cable that is used to connect to a computer to load the actual scripts to the unit. Connects to right side of Zen.(3) long micro usb cable to use in wire mode on controller, or for duping a controller when using another. Connects to left side of Zen. Or front left depending on what configuration your running.Front ports are for mouse&keyboard or wire controller.Flashing firmware is easy, load firmware update program from website and connect to pc via short cable attached to back of Zen and press small button on bottom of Zen to put it in bootloader status and flash.Programming is straight forward, plug into right side of Zen and connect to pc and run the Zen programming software found on the website.You can select a Zen made script or one of the main fan based scripts. Loading each one into the 8 available slots. Then write them to the unit.Switch between each profile by pressing the right blue button.Changing the scripts to suit your needs on the fly is straight forward press left trigger and select, this opens the script up and then you can scroll through what's editable. You need to check each scripts docentaion as each is different.I run this on an Xbox one X, I have used this with a standard wireless joypad and have also used it on a wired joypad. Both work with no issues.I borrowed a series 2 elite controller and have successfully paired and used this. Note** I was unable to get the series 2 Elite controller to work in the Xbox Elite controller app wireless I had to put the usb in the left port of the zen and connect it to joypad. This only needs to be done when you want to map buttons. Once mapped and uploaded, I unplugged the joypad and used it wireless and the joypad worked with the Settings I had programmed it with.As my joypads are wireless I have a Xbox wireless adapter plugged into the front left.I also use a wireless Astro headset so don't use the 3.5mm port in joypad.So, Am I happy with the unit YES. It does need a pc to program it but once done it's flawless, the scripts are free, so don't ever BUY any the ones that are fan based are free and work really well.Installation overall was easy little head scratching at one point but power cycling Xbox to restart fixed the issue.Would I recommend this YES already have and two friends have purchased.It is worth the money YES, for the fact you can use mouse and keyboard and that it gives you some nice perks depending on the scripts. I originally purchased it for mouse and keyboard, being a PC gamer, but been out of the loop for some time. So use to using a joypad I have stuck with this. Muscle memory.There is alot of YouTube video available to set the unit up on Xbox, Pc, PlayStation.Playing with a PlayStation pad on an Xbox and vice versa, or playing with either console pads on a pc.And installing scripts and modifying them on the fly.I am looking at getting a strike pack for my Xbox controller, so will update this review with my findings.Hope this helps...

They are great for sleeping and can help you to focus or to concentrate while studying, working or reading. And of course, they are a must have while traveling or commuting.    EASY TO USE - These earplugs are easy to insert and when you wear them correctly, they don't stick out of your ears. They come in 4 sizes (XS - L), if your ears hurt, it is best to take a smaller size. If the earplugs do not reduce sound sufficiently or fall out, it is best to try on a size larger.    IN THE BOX - In Loop Quiet's eco-friendly packaging, there is 1 set of Loop Quiet earplugs, 4 sizes of soft silicone ear tips (XS-L) and 1 handy carry case. Our earplugs are reusable and washable, providing a sustainable solution to disposable plugs.

They don‚Äôt block sound, they do divert your attention.

First, they don‚Äôt block sound. I can still hear everything around me. Wearing a pair of snug in-ear earphones switched off would have the same effect.However, there is something performatively useful as a ceremony about putting something in your ear as a block against the world (because you‚Äôre settling yourself up to be tranquil) and I suppose it would be useful that other people would be able to see them and know you‚Äôre trying to dial down.The longer you wear them the more your brain disconnects from the background noise. It‚Äôs like you‚Äôre diverting your attention. That‚Äôs their secret.They are very comfortable and they do have four different sizes of earbud tip.They aren‚Äôt like good noise cancelling headphones that do block noise. If you notice a noise (eg a cough or a passing van) then you‚Äôre back in the room.I wanted them to dampen the near-distant sound of the traffic as I try to read and think while working at home but without having to have music on. What they do is to immerse you in a world with the noise dialled down a little. I can still hear the traffic but the sound of my tinnitus and the noises of my own breathing and saliva, etc are elevated. My brain is diverted from the bad outside noises to inside-head noises. If you‚Äôre doing something (working, cooking, gardening) then you may realise after a while that you haven‚Äôt noticed much noise until something called you back (your phone, a passing van). You can hear all the nearby noises (typing, somebody talking to you, chopping veg).So, I think they‚Äôre useful to divert your attention away from bothersome external noise but I really do question whether they‚Äôre worth the money.

Report
Brian5.0 out of 5 stars
Best game ever made even better.
Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 9 September 2022Style Name: SingleVerified Purchase
One of the best games ever made has been made even better.A lot of people seem to be complaining about this re-release, which some points I can understand like the price being too high for a remake of a decade old game. I however had no problem paying that price as this is one of the best games ever made and anyone who has played the original on PS3 or remaster on PS4 would understand.There have been many improvements in this remake, the main one obviously being the graphics. This is probably the best looking game out there right now, better than The last of us part 2 (tlou2) and horizon forbidden west. The facial animations are much better allowing for a much more impressive and emotional experience than the original.The gameplay also flows a lot better than the original thanks to the new AI taken from TLOU2. While there haven't been any new gameplay additions, the gameplay is just generally better than the original because of the new animations and AI. The haptic feedback is also pretty good, you can feel each movement but the use of triggers is not the best I have seen. Sometimes the triggers will just not work or the resistance is too minor to even make a difference, hopefully this is something that can be updated in a patch.I have seen complaints from people that they did not add the prone or dodge mechanics from TLOU2 which I think are pretty silly complaints. Joel is a 50 year old man while ellie is about 20 in TLOU2. How do people expect someone of Joel's age to be going prone and dodging attacks like he's some sort of ninja?I initially left this review when I still had an older 4K monitor that did not support HDR and was only 60hz. I have since gotten an OLED and replayed this remake again, it looks even better, its absolutely phenomenal. The HDR implementation is probably the best I have ever seen, it truly makes the experience completely different and makes the game look even more realistic. This game also has VRR support and runs at a consistent 70-80fps in the performance mode (1440p upscaled to 4K), even 90fps in some cutscenes which is really impressive for a game with such good graphics and fidelity, making the whole experience even better. The quality mode runs at a native 4K at 30fps with slightly better textures than performance mode but its not enough of a difference to cut your frame rate in half, and if you have a TV with VRR, it will run at 40fps in the quality mode.While this remake wasn't necessarily necessary as the original still holds up somewhat well today. This remake is great, especially for people who have never played the original and want to get into the series and experience some of the best storytelling is gaming and dont want to have to deal with the outdated graphics and mechanics of the original.Overall, a great remake that I highly recommend for new or existing fans of The Last of us.

Daniel Malpas5.0 out of 5 stars
Exactly as expected, the same game, but at it's best.
Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 5 September 2022Style Name: SingleVerified Purchase
Product-wise, it showed up on time and in perfect condition for a better price than most others selling it. Now to talk about the game.It's the same beloved game, rebuilt on their new engine tech (yes rebuilt, it doesn't take a genius to see this isn't just a simple port job). Just as advertised. It admittedly feels a shame that we didn't get the dodge mechanic from part 2 but it certainly doesn't ruin the experience. This project feels anything but lazy. It's stunning, one of the most stunning games I've ever played, perhaps THE most. It's a remarkable story that stuck with me since I first played the original 7-8 years ago, and the new gunplay and feeling of the gameplay is top-notch. Everything is so fluid and feels really grounded and gritty, it's so much fun. The level of care and attention put into every corner of this game is stunning. And I'd recommend playing with a decent pair of headphones. I underestimated how cool the 3D audio tech would be, it really shines here.If you played the PS4 version and were satisfied and aren't much of a replayer, it isn't gonna be worth the price tag for you. If you played it and do really like replaying your favorites, like me, I doubt you'd be disappointed. There's plenty of replay value and they've taken advantage of all the new stuff on offer for PS5. It's also worth it if you have some disabilities that prevented you playing on PS4, because the new accessibility stuff is amazing.Essentially, it's a game for everyone who thinks the price is worth the product. A little bit like...every game ever.It doubles up as an attention magnet because anything with Last Of Us on it summons controversy, so there's some more value added :)

Kieran Begg5.0 out of 5 stars

The Last of Us 1 when it was originally released in 2013 was a show stopper. It changed the way games were perceived and showed how games were meant to be made. It's downside was the capabilities of the technology at the time.Jump forward to 2014 when The Last of Remastered was released on PS4 and it showed how the game was meant to look, but that's all it was just a graphical overhall.Now 8 years later we get a remake using modern technology which blows the originals out of the water. It truly blew my mind seeing a destroyed Boston in 4K HDR and to see the character models and their facial expression in clear 4K was incredible.It keeps its difficulty level and it's replayability, but takes alot of mechanics from The Last of Us Part 2 which made it officially The Best Game Ever Made and utilized it well, so for those used to Part 2 are able to just pick up the controller and play.Speaking of whith the use of the haptics in the controller really create a real sense of urgency and fear as you can feel the footsteps and the strain of the triggers as you fire your gun is really fear inducing. Connection: Bluetooth.Controller #1 - Steel Series Stratos Duo. Price paid: ¬£64.99 not including phone mount.It looked the business, and with gaming sites recommending it, I bought it straight away and was initially not disapointed. Battery is built in, the look and feel is excellent and it holds comfortably like an X-Box controller. When not in use it goes to sleep by itself to preserve battery. The only slight disapointment was the Steel Series phone mount prevents you from plugging a USB lead in whilst it's attached - meaning you have to faff around removing it when it's time to re-charge.  But, the recharge wasn't needed often - battery life was good, and the LED's tell you how much remains. Other reviews have complained that the 4 LED's flash every few seconds when connected to Bluetooth - it didn't bother me.However, I really struggled with controlling my car in F1 Mobile Racing.  The steering seemed delayed and digital, applying counter steer was impossible. I started to look for other controllers which might perform better, and I also consider that the game itself is at fault here - the game doesn't officially support controllers on Android, and this shows. Also, be aware that this controller is not supported at all by Call of Duty.Quality appears to be Steel Series achilles heal, and after just two or three weeks of gaming, the "B" button stopped working properly, causing the controller to lock-up when this is pressed. If it wasn't for this fault, I'd probably have kept this controller and been reasonably happy, even without being able to play Call of Duty.Pro's:Materials quality, finishBatteryComfortable to holdSleep works wellCon's:It brokePhone mount is fiddlyNot all games support itController #2 - Jevogh Xbox one Controller JV24.  Price paid: ¬£45.00.Note:  I didn't try this controller with Call of Duty.Whilst trying to work out why my Formula One car was so uncontrollable, I bought this significantly cheaper controller to do a comparison. It worked just as badly for controlling the car, and wasn't a very nice controller and I quickly returned it.Controller #3 - Sony Playstation Dualshock 4. Price paid: ¬£44.99By this time I had tried Call of Duty and seen the error of my ways...  I don't have a Playstation these days and didn't realise the controllers are Bluetooth compatible, and work with Android.  Suddenly my F1 car is more controllable, and my laptimes have improved - it's hard to pinpoint the exact difference (analogue stick deadzone, perhaps?), and F1 Mobile Racing is still not perfect, but it's a lot better.I've had a few connection issues, and I'm also unsure of the state of charge of the controller battery... Without having a Playstation to tell me this, I have no indication and I suppose it could run out of battery mid-game. Worse, it doesn't seem to go to sleep, so you have to turn off your phones bluetooth unless you want the battery to drain. You also have to avoid certain USB fast chargers if you wan't to avoid killing the battery. Furthermore, I've had some Bluetooth connectivity issues - I had to re-start my phone, and re-pair the connection to get it working again. Although I think this is potentially teething issues whilst I get used to how it pairs.Finally, the first phone mount I bought snapped literally within hours... It seems Sony have designed a controller that is inherantly difficult to mount a phone onto (because of the touch-pad front button), and the plastic mounts have to curve around this button, with a thin plastic section. So, be prepared for breakages of this part.Pro'sSupported by more Android gamesController quality is very highCon'sNot as comfortable to holdNo indication of battery charge levelBluetooth connection unreliableDon't use a fast-chargerPhone mounts are fragileIn conclusion, I thought this would be really simple;  buy a controller, have more fun on games.  But it's turned into a saga of buying and returning hardware to find something suitable for purpose, and even now the Sony PS4 controller is not perfect for the job.

The Echo Show 5 is a compact but powerful machine, combining the convenience of a smart display with the functionality of an alarm clock and much more, turning my home into a "smart" home.Be prepared though, as the other day the Echo Show 5 read out quite an embarrassing text message from my girlfriend in front of my mum. While demonstrating its hands-free capabilities, I casually asked Alexa to read out my latest text. Little did I know that the timing was impeccable, that I had received an inappropriate text, and the Echo Show 5, with its clearer sound, projected the message in a way that turned a mundane demonstration into a shared moment of laughter.As the robotic voice relayed the text, my mum and I couldn't help but burst into laughter, turning an otherwise ordinary day into a memorable one. It's moments like these that remind me that technology, even in its smartest forms, can surprise us with its unexpected sense of humour and innocent-ness.One of the immediate improvements with this 3rd Gen release is the sound quality. The Echo Show 5 now delivers clearer and more robust audio, making it a delightful device for enjoying music, watching videos, or engaging in hands-free calls. The enhanced sound clarity adds a layer of richness to the overall user experience.The compact form factor of the Echo Show 5 is perfect for those looking to maximize functionality without sacrificing space. The 5.5-inch display is just the right size, providing a clear and vibrant interface for everything from checking the weather to streaming content. The adaptive colour display intelligently adjusts to the ambient lighting, ensuring optimal visibility at any time of day.As an alarm clock, the Echo Show 5 excels with its customizable clock faces and multiple alarm options. The visual representation of alarms adds a touch of personalization, and the sunrise alarm feature gently brightens the display to mimic the natural sunrise, helping users wake up more naturally and feeling refreshed.The device seamlessly integrates with Alexa, allowing for hands-free control of smart home devices, information retrieval, and more. The improved processing power in this 3rd Gen model contributes to a snappy and responsive user interface, ensuring a smooth and enjoyable user experience.The privacy features, including a physical camera shutter and the ability to mute the microphone with the press of a button, provide users with peace of mind regarding their privacy and security.In conclusion, the Echo Show 5 is a stellar addition to Amazon's smart display line-up. It successfully marries form and function, delivering clearer sound, a vibrant display, and a plethora of features in a compact package. Whether you're looking for a smart alarm clock or a versatile smart display, the Echo Show 5 is a top-notch choice that continues to elevate the smart home experience.

False positives

Like the other women in the reviews, I received false positives. I ordered two boxes (four tests in total). Three came back with a very faint blue line within the three minute timeframe. I never counted any result after ten minutes. The tests did not change at all for me. Even hours later. You could still see the same faint positive. The line was thick so it wasn‚Äôt a evap. The other one had a dye run so had to be completely discounted. I also picked up two of the same brand from the supermarket. One I used which gave me another false positive. I ran the other one under water to see if a line would appear. Absolutely nothing. Not even a hint of a line. I‚Äôve tested on three consecutive mornings. The line hasn‚Äôt gotten darker which is usually what happens due to hcg increasing. I used it first thing in the day. Then I started to notice signs my period was coming (cramps, swollen breasts), and took that to mean I was not pregnant. However, I‚Äôve read hundreds of accounts of women who believed they were coming in their period and were in fact pregnant. I will test again with a digital if I am late just to be certain. But, I‚Äôm 99% sure I‚Äôm not. Reading these reviews has solidified that for me. It‚Äôs important to note that on other sites, women are leaving reviews with the same issues. I wasn‚Äôt trying to conceive, but after seeing that positive I was actually excited. I cannot imagine the heartbreak of actively trying month after month, having fertility issues, having lost pregnancies, and getting a false positive result. It is absolutely criminal. These need pulling from the market.

nav: Headphones, Earphones & Accessories ‚Ä∫ Headphones & Earphones ‚Ä∫ In-Ear Headphones
user_reviews:
Chris Hughes5.0 out of 5 stars
Surprisingly good
Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 4 December 2023Colour Name: GraphiteVerified Purchase
TLDR if you've got a Samsung smartphone, the cash to spare, and want something with more features and smarter integration than budget earphones I think these are a good buy. Sound quality is great for earbuds.I bought these off the back of many years of using another popular budget to mid range brand. These were significantly more expensive than what I usually get but I wanted to try something different and which hopefully lasts longer. These have really nice integration with my phone and a bunch of extra features. I'm particularly fond of the pass through mode which is very clear indoors and on occasion the amplified pass through setting when I'm out walking in a quiet spot and I pause the music and I want to hear what's going on around me without touching my earphones or obviously looking around. This brings me round to the only criticism I have which is although the fit test was a really nice feature I sometimes find them slipping out of position and if I push them back in I activate the play/pause touch function which cannot be remapped. It would be nice to be able to map play/pause to a double tap but sadly you can't do that in the app. Also the noise cancelling and pass through modes only work when you have both earphones in, and personally I tend to prefer only one earphone at a time. I'm still getting used to only gripping them at the very edges and that I don't need to pause first when taking them out as they will usually auto pause when they detect they are not in your ear. Voice detect is nice on paper but I'm not sure it works well enough for me as I'm typically softly spoken. It seems to lower the volume based on how loud you are talking, but for me it can end up in an awkward middle ground if I'm listening to something and start talking to someone then I can't properly hear what the other person is saying and whatever I'm listening to just becomes annoying and I'm aware I'm missing it, so I usually just end up pausing it anyway. If I speak loudly initially it will effectively mute whatever I had been listening to, which is good, but when I start talking softly again the whole exchange just comes across like I was angry at being interrupted or something. In fairness though it is very handy when I'm doing washing up not having to touch my ears. Lastly the battery life is really good, about what I have come to expect from other earphones where on the rare occasions that I have used them for extended periods I seem to get roughly 5 to 6 hours on one earphone at a medium volume (as in I can still clearly hear everything going on around me) and I charge the case maybe once or twice per week. Which while I'm on the subject the case light will shine green, yellow or red depending on how much is left in the battery, which I thought was nice. And the case seems sturdy so hopefully the top won't break off this one!Overall I think these are great so far and I would buy them again if I was looking to spend a bit more money on something good.

The packaging of the product feels very premium and the material used for the case especially feels extremely polished and I definitely prefer the look to the AirPods case(s)One thing I will also say is that the shape is very easy to fit the ear and the entire process feels seamless, I prefer that there is no stem as It feels like the product has a better design and for those who are unaware, these earbuds have an extremely high water resistance rating which allows me to wear these whilst in the shower.The audio quality is even better than I expected, Samsung owns the company responsible for determining the universally best EQ and it‚Äôs very clear within this product as the sound is incredible for earbuds. not too much base but also great clarity within the audio.I cannot comment on the interface since I don‚Äôt have the app due to being an iPhone user, this means that I have no access to all of the configurations that the software provides however I don‚Äôt really feel as though I need it. Noise Cancellation is automatically enabled whenever the earphones are initially turned on and in order to toggle transparency mode it is a simple hold of one of the earbuds whilst it‚Äôs in your ear.I used to own Sony XM4 headphones which had ridiculously great noise cancelling but sold them due to wanting the money back, I found that these earphones whilst (obviously) being less potent in noise cancellation, they still block out a lot of noise especially the low frequency noises such as a fan or humming etc. voices are also quite drastically muffled.I will say though that the noise cancellation is far from perfect and you may be underwhelmed if you were under the impression that these would be able to provide noise cancelling on par with actual ANC headphones. particularly when it comes to higher frequencies such as a shower etc.I am overall extremely happy with the comfort of these earbuds and didn‚Äôt even think that earphones could be this comfortable. If you‚Äôre looking for quality earphones with good noise cancelling and a great EQ then I‚Äôd have to recommend these.I will say however that if you aren‚Äôt too bothered with the 15% larger size of the buds2 pro‚Äôs predecessor (i.e., the buds pro), and don‚Äôt want better water resistance nor are you bothered too much about noise cancellation, i‚Äôd probably suggest you get the older version as as far as I can tell, those are the main differences other than more options i‚Äôm the app for the newer earbuds (which I don‚Äôt even have access to regardless)

NewKaKaYork5.0 out of 5 stars
Still plays very well on my average laptop !
Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 16 April 2012Verified Purchase
This game really takes me back a few years ! I have lots of fond memories of playing this on the old machine that was the Playstation 2.I wanted to pick this title up on PC for something to play on my laptop when I am away from home (can't take my Xbox 360 everywhere!). I'm running a very average spec laptop on Windows 7, it's not a gaming laptop by any stretch of the imagination. I'm running an Athlon II Dual Core 2.1GB processor, 4GB ram (memory), 64-bit operating system and an ATI Mobility Radeon HD4200 graphics chip.There was no question of buying the game, only how it would run on my laptop. Got the game, installed in minutes and runs very nicely indeed ! I have to run the draw distance quite low and I haven't had any hectic moments in the game yet but it's all running smoothly. I have a feeling that it may slow down on the bigger fights but that's a small price to pay for playing this amazing game.I was prepared for the game to look very dated but I am very surprised to see that it still looks pretty fresh. I'm sure that I have hours of fun ahead of me. If you have enjoyed any of the other titles in the GTA series, you need to play this game. If you're an old fan and are making a return to the game, enjoy and dive straight in !!I hope this review helps a few people who are worried about the performance of their PC's or laptop's, if it's any higher spec than mine then you're golden.Please leave a comment if you have any questions.Martin

üôÇ5.0 out of 5 stars
Such a great compilation!
Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 20 September 2020Platform: Nintendo SwitchEdition: All-StarsVerified Purchase
Super Mario 3D All Stars is a fantastic compilation of Mario's first 3 mainline adventures. From Super Mario 64 for the 1996 Nintendo 64 console to Super Mario Galaxy on the 2006 Wii console. If you'd like to play these classics in all their glory on "official" hardware, go for this collection.Pros:-It's Mario!-There are 3 games, which total to just over 95 HOURS of content, if you intend to complete each title to completion (i.e all the stars, extra levels etc.)-These are graphically enchanced and have new controls that use joy-cons to their fullest.-The latest and official way to play these titlesCons:-It's expensive at 44.99 (but you ARE paying for the Mario and Nintendo brand)-It's limited until March 2021, so if you want the title, you need to get it quickly, or pay the same price for the digital copy on the eShop.-The titles are emulated, meaning they're not newly created ports, they're run from an emulator within the cartridge, so if you're someone who has a computer and likes emulation, may as well just use an emulator to play these titles, which can sometimes be better, depending on what sort of experience you want-The controls can be awkward, and the controls and camera for Super Mario 64 are VERY outdated, which may frustrate newer and younger players.In short, it's an amazing collection which you can take on the go, and has so much content that I think is definitely worth the price, but you need to grab it quickly if you want to play it, as this is a limited release which ends in March 2021.

The Pokemon Go Plus +, a new accessory aimed at enhancing gameplay, comes with a mix of successes and glitches. Intended to make the game more immersive without constantly staring at the phone screen, it offers improved features like auto-throw and auto-spin. However, these features often malfunction, requiring a series of troubleshooting steps to activate and maintaining connectivity remains an issue.The device itself is well-designed, with a sleek appearance and tactile buttons that offer a satisfying experience. It includes a wrist strap and a peculiar sleep-tracking function that connects with Pokemon Sleep, although it tends to activate unintentionally throughout the day. Despite its potential, the Plus + fails to fully address the issues of the Plus line, altering gameplay dynamics and sometimes pushing players towards in-game purchases to manage inventory shortages caused by its mechanics.While it boasts improvements such as a rechargeable battery via USB-C, the glitches in auto-mode and sleep tracking currently hinder its recommendation. Additionally, its larger size compared to its predecessor makes it less convenient for everyday carry.

Dave4.0 out of 5 stars
Great update to a classic game
Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 6 January 2016Verified Purchase
When playing monopoly, the most tedious part was always counting out all the different notes for each player at the start of the game - it took forever!  Well that is now a thing of the past.  Each player has a Credit/Debit card and the banker operates an easy to use keypad to add/remove/transfer money between players.  This means you can open the box and be playing within 2 minutes.  The other benefit of this system is that it makes it much harder for people to cheat.  I would have given this game 5 stars but I deducted 1 star because they've increased the prices of everything (although this may have happened in other recent monopoly games, I hadn't played for about 20 years before getting this set) which I think spoils it a little bit.Other things worth noting is that only 4 people can play this version (you only get 4 bank cards) and the bank machine does need 2 AAA batteries.

title: Sony PlayStation Classic Console
description: Preloaded with 20 of the best PlayStation games, including Battle Arena Toshinden, Cool Boarders 2, Destruction Derby, Final Fantasy VII, Grand Theft Auto, Intelligent Qube, Jumping Flash!, Metal Gear Solid, Mr. Driller, Oddworld: Abe‚Äôs Oddysee, Rayman, Resident Evil Director‚Äôs Cut, Revelations: Persona, Ridge Racer Type 4, Super Puzzle Fighter II Turbo, Syphon Filter, Tekken 3, Tom Clancy‚Äôs Rainbow Six, Twisted Metal, Wild Arms    PlayStation Classic mirrors the original PlayStation console with the same logo, button layout and packaging    Comes with two wired controllers in the box

nav: Legacy Systems ‚Ä∫ PlayStation Systems ‚Ä∫ PlayStation ‚Ä∫ Consoles
user_reviews:
Jamie Smith5.0 out of 5 stars
Snake! SNAKE! SNAAAAAAKE!
Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 9 March 2019Verified Purchase
Never one to ever review products on Amazon (as far as I can remember, anyway), I suddenly feel compelled to do so seeing as I impulse-bought a Playstation Classic after consistently hearing about how terrible they are; that probably makes me sound like a moron but, hey.This thing is awesome. I'm not a hardcore gamer (I have a PC that's capable of playing most games on high if not ultra settings, but it's used mostly for media editing and occasionally brutal doom). I did grow up with a couple of Playstations in the house. I didn't play every one of these games back in the day (some of them are admittedly more obscure than others). The games often look, and control, like ass.I'll assume the decision to include games like Persona Revelations, Wild Arms, Intelligent Qube, and Mr Driller was down to some behind-the-scenes difficulties (titles like Crash, Spyro, Tomb Raider and others would have been more warmly received looking at what people are saying online).To me, the Playstation Classic doesn't provide a comprehensive library of the most beloved games of its time (so it's maybe not doing the notion of a "Classic" console - previously executed well by Nintendo and Neo Geo - much justice); but it does provide 20 games which are still a lot of fun to play. It does it in a nice, efficient, well-presented package. It's the easiest possible thing to set up, and there's no need to install, update, prepare, or wait for anything (which is why I'd rather use this than spend time setting up a retropie).Even once you exit a game, save states allow you to immediately pick up where you left off without needing to actually save to the emulated memory cards. If you just want to switch off and play some old games for a few hours, this is a really good package. Even with Resident Evil's ass-like tank controls, or the slightly stiff driving of Destruction Derby, I honestly am having more fun with games than I've done in the past decade. It makes me nostalgic, and I'd happily have paid the original ¬£90 for this.So it doesn't tick every box - who cares!? Neither do you, and people still like you a lot. I do, anyway.
